title: No Mercurius aquaticus, but a cable-rope, double twisted for Iohn Tayler, the water-poet, who escaping drowning in a paper-wherry-voyage, is reserved for another day as followeth, viz by John Booker.
author: Booker, John, 1603-1667.
publisher: Printed according to order for G. B.,
notes: An answer to John Taylor's "Mercurius aquaticus" of 18 January 1644.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
